1.text: Then answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said,

2.text: Can a man be profitable unto God? surely he that is wise is profitable unto himself.

3.text: Is it any pleasure to the Almighty, that thou art righteous? or is it gain to him, that thou makest thy ways perfect?

4.text: Is it for thy fear of him that he reproveth thee, that he entereth with thee into judgment?

5.text: Is not thy wickedness great? neither is there any end to thine iniquities.

6.text: For thou hast taken pledges of thy brother for nought, and stripped the naked of their clothing.

7.text: Thou hast not given water to the weary to drink, and thou hast withholden bread from the hungry.

8.text: But as for the mighty man, he had the earth; and the honourable man, he dwelt in it.

9.text: Thou hast sent widows away empty, and the arms of the fatherless have been broken.

10.text: Therefore snares are round about thee, and sudden fear troubleth thee,

11.text: Or darkness, that thou canst not see, and abundance of waters cover thee.

12.text: Is not God in the height of heaven? and behold the height of the stars, how high they are!

13.text: And thou sayest, What doth God know? can he judge through the thick darkness?

14.text: Thick clouds are a covering to him, that he seeth not; and he walketh in the circuit of heaven.

15.text: Wilt thou keep the old way which wicked men have trodden?

16.text: Who were snatched away before their time, whose foundation was poured out as a stream:

17.text: Who said unto God, Depart from us; and, What can the Almighty do for us?

18.text: Yet he fired their houses with good things: but the counsel of the wicked is far from me.

19.text: The righteous see it, and are glad; and the innocent laugh them to scorn:

20.text: Saying, Surely they that did rise up against us are cut off, and the remnant of them the fire hath consumed.

21.text: Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace: thereby good shall come unto thee.

22.text: Receive, I pray thee, the law from his mouth, and lay up his words in thine heart.

23.text: If thou return to the Almighty, thou shalt be built up; if thou put away unrighteousness far from thy tents.

24.text: And lay thou thy treasure in the dust, and the gold of Ophir among the stones of the brooks;

25.text: And the Almighty shall be thy treasure, and precious silver unto thee.

26.text: For then shalt thou delight thyself in the Almighty, and shalt lift up thy face unto God.

27.text: Thou shalt make thy prayer unto him, and he shall hear thee; and thou shalt pay thy vows.

28.text: Thou shalt also decree a thing, and it shall be established unto thee; and light shall shine upon thy ways.

29.text: When they cast thee down, thou shalt say, There is lifting up; and the humble person he shall save.

30.text: He shall deliver even him that is not innocent: yea, he shall be delivered through the cleanness of thine hands.
